documents.title: Corporate Expense Reimbursement Policy
documents.content:
EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT POLICY

Effective Date: January 1, 2024
Policy Owner: Chief Financial Officer

1. PURPOSE

This policy establishes guidelines for reimbursement of business-related expenses incurred by employees on behalf of the Company.

2. SCOPE

This policy applies to all employees, contractors, and directors who incur expenses for authorized business purposes.

3. GENERAL PRINCIPLES

- All expenses must be reasonable, necessary, and for legitimate business purposes
- Expenses must be properly documented with original receipts
- Claims must be submitted within 30 days of incurring the expense
- Personal expenses are not reimbursable
- The Company expects employees to exercise cost-consciousness

4. MEAL AND ENTERTAINMENT EXPENSES

4.1 Daily Meal Allowances (when traveling on business):

  - Breakfast: HK$80
  - Lunch: HK$120
  - Dinner: HK$200
  - Total daily maximum: HK$400

4.2 Local Business Meals:

  - With clients/external parties: Up to HK$500 per person
  - Internal team meals: Up to HK$200 per person
  - Must have clear business purpose
  - List attendees and business purpose on expense claim

4.3 Entertainment:

  - Requires prior approval from Department Head for amounts over HK$1,000
  - Director approval required for amounts over HK$5,000
  - Alcohol: Reasonable consumption allowed when entertaining clients
  - Must be business-related and appropriate

5. TRAVEL EXPENSES

5.1 Air Travel:

  - Flights under 4 hours: Economy class
  - Flights 4-8 hours: Premium economy allowed for senior management
  - Flights over 8 hours: Business class allowed for senior management
  - All flights: Economy class for general staff
  - Book in advance to get best rates

5.2 Accommodation:

  - Hong Kong: Up to HK$1,800 per night
  - Mainland China: Up to RMB 1,200 per night
  - Asia (excl. Japan): Up to USD 200 per night
  - Japan: Up to USD 250 per night
  - Europe/Americas: Up to USD 300 per night
  - Exceptions require CFO approval

5.3 Ground Transportation:

  - Taxis: Reimbursable for business travel
  - Public transport: Always reimbursable
  - Car rental: Requires prior approval from Department Head
  - Personal vehicle: Reimbursed at HK$2.50 per kilometer
  - Parking: Reimbursable with receipts

5.4 Travel Approval:

  - Domestic travel: Department Head approval
  - International travel: Director approval
  - Travel budget over HK$20,000: CFO approval required

6. COMMUNICATION EXPENSES

6.1 Mobile Phone:

  - Employees with business need: HK$400/month allowance OR company phone
  - Data roaming when traveling: Up to HK$500 per trip (pre-approval needed)
  - Excess charges require justification

6.2 Internet:

  - Hotel internet: Fully reimbursable
  - Mobile hotspot rental: Up to HK$150 per day

7. OTHER BUSINESS EXPENSES

- Professional memberships: Up to HK$5,000 per year (with manager approval)
- Business publications/subscriptions: Up to HK$2,000 per year
- Training and conferences: Per professional development policy
- Client gifts: Up to HK$1,000 per gift (with manager approval)
- Office supplies: Generally purchased through procurement, not reimbursed

8. DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS

8.1 All expense claims must include:

  - Completed expense claim form
  - Original itemized receipts (credit card slips insufficient)
  - Business purpose and attendees (for meals/entertainment)
  - Approval signatures as required

8.2 Receipt Thresholds:

  - Receipts required for all expenses over HK$100
  - Expenses under HK$100: Receipt preferred but not mandatory
  - Missing receipts: Require written explanation and manager approval
  - Maximum HK$500 per month in non-receipted expenses

9. SUBMISSION AND PAYMENT

- Submit claims online via expense management system
- Include all supporting documents (scan and attach)
- Deadline: Within 30 days of expense date
- Late submissions require written explanation
- Payment: Processed within 14 days of approval
- Payment method: Direct deposit to employee's bank account

10. APPROVAL LIMITS

- Up to HK$5,000: Manager approval
- HK$5,001 to HK$20,000: Department Head approval
- Over HK$20,000: Director or CFO approval

11. NON-REIMBURSABLE EXPENSES

✗ Personal entertainment or leisure activities
✗ Traffic fines or parking violations
✗ Expenses for family members (unless approved in advance)
✗ Excessive or luxury expenses
✗ Tips exceeding 10%
✗ Expenses incurred more than 90 days ago
✗ Alcoholic beverages (except when entertaining clients)
✗ Personal grooming, toiletries
✗ Mini-bar charges (except reasonable beverages)
✗ Personal phone calls

12. POLICY VIOLATIONS

Submitting fraudulent or inappropriate expense claims may result in:
- Claim rejection
- Requirement to repay any amounts paid
- Disciplinary action up to and including termination
- Legal action in cases of fraud

13. QUESTIONS

Contact Finance Department: finance@company.com | +852 2123-4567

documents.title: Employee Handbook - Travel and Expenses Section
documents.content:
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK

Section 8: Travel and Expense Reimbursement

Last Updated: November 15, 2023

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

BUSINESS TRAVEL

When you travel for business, the Company will reimburse your reasonable and necessary expenses. Please be cost-conscious and treat Company money as you would your own.

BOOKING TRAVEL

• Use our corporate travel agency (TravelCorp) for flights and hotels
• Book flights at least 14 days in advance when possible
• Choose economy class for flights (all employees)
• Select mid-range hotels within our guidelines
• Car rentals must be pre-approved by your manager

MEALS WHILE TRAVELING

Daily Meal Allowance:

When traveling overnight on business, you can claim up to:
• Breakfast: HK$100
• Lunch: HK$150
• Dinner: HK$250
• Maximum per day: HK$500

You don't need to keep receipts for meals under the daily allowance - just claim the per diem amount. However, if you have receipts and your actual expenses are lower, claim only what you spent.

LOCAL BUSINESS MEALS

• Business lunches with clients: Up to HK$400 per person
• Business dinners with clients: Up to HK$600 per person
• Team lunches (no clients): Up to HK$150 per person
• Coffee meetings: Up to HK$100

Always keep receipts and note who attended and the business purpose.

TRANSPORTATION

• Taxis: Use for business travel, keep receipts
• MTR/Public transport: Always reimbursed, keep receipts if possible
• Uber/Grab: Acceptable, keep electronic receipts
• Personal car: HK$2.00 per km (estimate distance reasonably)
• Parking: Keep receipts

ACCOMMODATION

Hotel per night limits:
• Hong Kong: HK$1,500
• China: RMB 1,000
• Asia: USD 180
• Other: USD 250

If you need to exceed these limits due to location or conference hotel rates, get approval from your manager before booking.

PHONE AND INTERNET

• Mobile allowance: HK$400/month for eligible employees
• Hotel wifi: Fully covered
• International roaming: Up to HK$300 per trip
• If you expect higher roaming costs, discuss with your manager beforehand

OTHER EXPENSES

• Professional dues: Up to HK$3,000/year with manager approval
• Business books and publications: Up to HK$1,500/year
• Conferences and training: See professional development policy
• Client gifts: Up to HK$800 per gift

RECEIPTS

• Keep ALL receipts for expenses over HK$50
• For expenses under HK$50, receipts are appreciated but not required
• Credit card statements are not sufficient - need itemized receipts
• If you lose a receipt, explain why on your expense form and get manager approval

SUBMITTING EXPENSE CLAIMS

1. Complete the online expense form within 30 days
2. Upload photos/scans of all receipts
3. Explain business purpose
4. Get required approvals
5. Submit

Payment is usually processed within 2 weeks of approval.

APPROVALS NEEDED

• Your manager: All expenses up to HK$10,000
• Department Head: HK$10,000 to HK$30,000
• Finance Director: Over HK$30,000

WHAT'S NOT COVERED

✗ Personal travel or entertainment
✗ Expenses for family members
✗ Traffic tickets
✗ Excessive tips (keep under 15%)
✗ Luxury items or services
✗ Personal items like toiletries
✗ Hotel mini-bar (except soft drinks/water)
✗ In-room movies

QUESTIONS?

If you're unsure whether an expense is reimbursable, ask your manager or contact HR (hr@company.com) or Finance (finance@company.com) before incurring the expense.

REMEMBER: Use good judgment and treat Company resources responsibly!

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
RECEIPT REQUIREMENTS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Mandatory Receipts:
✓ All expenses HK$75 and above
✓ Meal/entertainment (any amount)
✓ Accommodation
✓ Flights
✓ Car rentals

Receipts Not Required:
○ Public transport under HK$75
○ Parking under HK$75
○ Tips (if within 10%)

→ Written explanation required
→ Manager must approve
→ Max HK$300/month without receipts

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
APPROVAL MATRIX
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Claim Amount          Approver
─────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Up to HK$3,000        Direct Manager
HK$3,001 - HK$15,000  Department Head
HK$15,001 - HK$50,000 Finance Director
Over HK$50,000        CFO

Travel Pre-Approval:
├─ Domestic ............. Manager
├─ Regional ............. Department Head
└─ Long-haul ............ Director + Finance

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
SUBMISSION PROCESS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

1. LOGIN
   → expense.company.com
   → Use your company credentials

2. CREATE CLAIM
   → Click "New Expense Report"
   → Select expense type
   → Enter date and amount

3. UPLOAD RECEIPTS
   → Photo or PDF
   → Max 5MB per file
   → JPG, PNG, PDF accepted

4. BUSINESS PURPOSE
   → Required for all claims
   → Include names for meals/entertainment
   → Be specific and clear

5. SUBMIT
   → Review carefully
   → Route to appropriate approver
   → System sends email notification

6. PAYMENT
   → Processed within 10 business days of approval
   → Direct deposit to your salary account
   → Check payslip for expense reimbursement line

Deadline: Submit within 30 days of expense date
Late submissions (30-60 days): Require explanation
Very late (60-90 days): Require Director approval
Over 90 days: Generally not reimbursed

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
COMMON REJECTION REASONS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

❌ No receipt attached (over HK$75)
❌ Missing business purpose
❌ Exceeds policy limit without approval
❌ Personal expense
❌ Duplicate claim
❌ Credit card slip only (need itemized receipt)
❌ Submitted too late (>90 days)
❌ Not pre-approved when required

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
TIPS FOR FASTER PROCESSING
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

✓ Submit claims promptly (don't wait until month-end)
✓ Use clear, legible receipt images
✓ Provide detailed business purpose
✓ Ensure expenses are within policy limits
✓ Get pre-approvals when required
✓ Combine related expenses in one report
✓ Double-check math and totals
